page.title: 03Transport around Newburgh
page.content: Newburgh has a bus garage, it is situated at the shore. It has about 11 double deckers and 10 singles. There are about 23 drivers who work two shifts, early shift and back shift, and some cleaners. Each morning at about 8.15am two double deckers go up the High Street to collect school children who go to the High School in Cupar. Most of the buses run from Newburgh to Perth, then from Perth to Kirkcaldy. There is a City Link run that is based in Newburgh but goes from Perth to Edinburgh. The main bus company is trying to stop this run.The buses leave and pass Newburgh every minute to the hour. A single track railway runs through the town. There was a station at one time, but it has been closed for some years. A few passenger and goods trains pass by each day.
